document.docTitle: Platicrista horribilis Kaczmarek & Michalczyk, 2003, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Platicrista horribilis, a new species of Tardigrada (Eutardigrada: Hypsibiidae) from Mongolia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Platicrista horribilis, a new species of Tardigrada (Eutardigrada: Hypsibiidae) from Mongolia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Measurements of some structures of holotype and two paratypes are shown in
Tab. 1
.

There is visible fine granulation on IV pair of legs in paratype 1 . Very slender cuticular bars are orientated backwards in paratype 1 (probably caused by preparation); in paratype 2 only one of these structures is visible. In some cases the teeth on lunules may resemble knobs.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype is preserved at the Zoological Museum of Jagiellonian University, ul. Ingardena 6, 30 ­060 Kraków, Poland ; paratype 1 is preserved at the Department of Animal Taxonomy and Ecology, A. Mickiewicz University, Poznañ; paratype 2 is preserved in the collection of oe. Michalczyk (Jagiellonian University).

Platicrista horribilis
is similar to
P. affine (Mihelcic, 1951 )
and
P. angustata (Murray, 1905 )
however, it is easily distinguishable by the presence of teeth on the lunules of the IV pair of legs (it was not mentioned in the description by
Ramazzotti & Maucci ( 1983 )
, however, the dilated bases are smooth in the drawings).

The new species differs from
P. itaquasconoide (Durante & Maucci, 1975 )
by lacking the microplacoid, small basal spur of the claw on the IV pair of legs and by having a narrower buccal tube ( 8 m in
P. itaquasconoide
).

Platicrista horribilis
differs from
P. cheleusis
Kathman, 1990
by lacking the polygonal pattern on cuticle and cuticular bars on legs.
